channel.title: Posts on Fur Trade Days
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Fur Trade Days

item.title: Mac's Carnival
item.description: Building on the great experience attendees had in 2019, Fur Trade Days is excited to welcome back Mac’s Carnival for 2021!

item.title: Fireworks
item.description: Fur Trade Days is ecstatic to announce a fireworks show 10 p.m. Saturday, July 10!

item.title: Entertainment!
item.description: Fur Trade Days is excited to bring you two great bands downtown on Friday and Saturday nights! Tripwire takes the stage Friday, Dylan Bloom is slated for Saturday.

item.title: Traders' Market
item.description: The Chadron Fur Trade Days Traders’ Market features merchants from around the area and across the country, and provides something for everyone. The 45th annual attraction is planned to remain at the crowd-favorite Dawes County Courthouse Lawn and boasts a slate of new merchants as well as familiar favorites!

item.title: Lions Club FTD Parade
item.description: The 45th Annual Lions Club Fur Trade Days Parade starts at 10 a.m. on Saturday, July 10 and proceeds down Main Street from Tenth to First streets. Candy and other goodies will be passed out along the parade route. Come early to claim a good seat and enjoy the excitement!

item.title: Activities and More
item.description: The String Beans will play a kid-friendly show Friday evening at the courthouse lawn, along with historical presentation, trick roping demonstration, and other activities.

item.title: Buckskinner's Camp
item.description: The Bordeaux Creek Fur Trade and Muzzleloading Associationâ€™s Rendezvous, located 3.5 miles east and 8 miles south of Chadron, is expected to open Thursday, July 8, for camp setup.
